mystery.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it
mystery.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Twenty years after the event, his death remains a mystery.
The way her mind worked was always a mystery to him.
‘Why did he do it?’ ‘I don’t know. It’s a complete mystery.’
The police never solved the mystery of Gray’s disappearance.
But why would anyone want to kill Jack? The mystery deepened.
What happened to the paintings after that is an unsolved mystery.
I don’t know how he got the job – it’s one of life’s little mysteries.
How life began on Earth is one of the great mysteries of science.
mystery.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the quality that something or someone has when they seem strange, secret, or difficult to understand or explain
mystery.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Her dark glasses gave her an air of mystery.
Annie knew that there was some mystery surrounding her birth.
The circumstances of his death were veiled in mystery.
mystery.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a subject, activity etc that is very complicated, secret, or difficult to understand, and that people want to learn about
mystery.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: his introduction to the mysteries of the perfume business
mystery.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a story, film, or play about a murder, in which you are not told who the murderer is until the end
mystery.translation[0].note_box[0].headi: – Meaning 1: an event, situation etc that people do not understand or cannot explain because they do not know enough about it
mystery.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: be a mystery
It’s a mystery how he got my phone number.
remain a mystery
What caused the accident remains a mystery.
solve/unravel a mystery
The children were given the clues and had to try to solve the mystery.
the mystery deepens
Why would he run away if he were not guilty? The mystery deepens.
the mystery surrounding something
Research has unravelled much of the mystery surrounding the ageing process.
a complete/total mystery
She said that her husband’s disappearance was a complete mystery.
an unsolved mystery
What happened to her is still an unsolved mystery.
a great mystery
It is one of the great mysteries of science.
a little/minor mystery
It was a minor mystery how the file had survived the fire.
a big mystery
If they are right, they have solved one of the biggest mysteries in astronomy.
something is one of life’s (little) mysteries
Where socks disappear to after they’ve been washed is one of life’s little mysteries.
mystery.translation[0].note_box[1].headi: – Meaning 2: the quality that something or someone has when they seem strange, secret, or difficult to understand or explain
mystery.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: The origins of this tradition remain shrouded in mystery.
Mystery has always surrounded the purpose of the great stone circle of Stonehenge.
the deep mystery of the human mind
We wondered about the great mystery of death.
There is an element of mystery and miracle in the process.
There was an air of mystery about him.
The garden had hidden corners that gave it a sense of mystery.
mystery.translation[1].definitions[0].de: used to describe someone or something that people do not recognize or know anything about, especially when this causes great interest
mystery.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Who was the mystery woman spotted on board the yacht with the prince?
